snippet: A commission member says he was told he had a conflict and should not vote on a project Gov. Chris Christie supports. He was told the order was from Mr. Christie’s office.
abstract: Michael Powell Gotham column contends George Washington Bridge lane closing is example of patented rhetorical move on part of New Jersey Gov Chris Christie to mete out retribution whenever he feels crossed; cites order from Christie's office that Pinelands Commission member Edward Lloyd recuse himself from voting on a proposal to put a 22-mile-long pipeline through the heart of the protected 1.1-million-acre expanse.
lead_paragraph: A commission member says he was told he had a conflict and should not vote on a project Gov. Chris Christie supports. He was told the order was from Mr. Christie’s office.

headline.print_headline: Fighting a Pipeline, but Feeling and Fearing Christie’s Influence
headline.main: Fighting a Pipeline, but Feeling and Fearing Christie’s Influence
